name: Avoid large Tables - too many columns (SQL)
description:
List of tables that have more (>) than <%PARAM%> columns.

Note threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will. Default value is 40 columns.
output:
This report lists all Tables with more than <%PARAM%> Columns
It provides the following information: 

- Table name
- Table full name
- Number of Columns
rationale:
All tables should not have more than <%PARAM%> Columns.

Data redundancy is good for backups but not for table data. Each table should contain a unique data set that doesn’t repeat data in other table locations.
remediation:
Consider normalizing the table design.

Normalization is a database design technique which organizes tables in a manner that reduces redundancy and dependency of data.
It divides larger tables to smaller tables and links them using relationships.
